clues.text: Beginning another word for a jack in a deck of playing cards
In a word for the side post of a doorway
Penultimate in a synonym for mucus; let me clear my throat!
In an old word for a compound produced in food by bacteria; it used to be found before "poisoning"
Starting a word from Arabic for "demon"
10th century: this Bohemian prince is murdered; later, he would Czech in as a saint
17th century: in 1642 the Mongols depose Tibet's rulers & offer the job to the guy with this title
12th century: construction of it begins in 1176; the British nursery rhyme & game, a bit after
3rd century: the first written reference to this Blue Man Group of present Scotland has them attacking Hadrian's Wall
6th century: this "B" list Roman translates Aristotle into Latin
The Gulf of Venice & the Gulf of Trieste lie at the northern end of this sea
The seat of Pinellas county, this Florida gulf coast city got its name when someone noticed springs with really...
The Gulf of Roses is part of this Costa in northeast Spain whose name can mean rugged as well as courageous
This gulf named for a Yemeni seaport was once a haven for piracy such as the hijacking of the Maersk Alabama in 2009
The Equator & prime meridian intersect in this gulf that stretches from Cape Lopez in Gabon to Cape Palmas in Liberia
The union rep within a workplace is the "shop" one of these; former labor secretary Hilda Solis' dad was one
Feline term for a strike by a group of employees without the consent of their union
Becky Pringle is president of this union, America's largest with about 3 million members
Born Mary Harris, she was called the "most dangerous woman in America" in 1902 for her success in organizing mine workers
The 2009 Fair Pay Act was named for this woman who sued her employer Goodyear for pay discrimination
Servants of Loughmask House, the Irish residence of this land agent, were told not to work there, giving rise to an eponym
This mythic king of Phrygia who was punished by having fruit just out of reach gave his name to a verb for that type of torment
This plant that has brilliant scarlet, pink or white petallike bracts is named for a U.S. minister to Mexico in the 1820s
CJD is short for this disease of the nervous system named for a pair of German neurologists
An inspector general of infantry, he shaped Louis XIV's regular army; his name lives on as a drillmaster or disciplinarian
In 2017, a group of Kentucky politicians were the first civilians let into this bullion depository in more than 40 years
This military installation in southern Nevada was originally selected in 1955 to test the U-2 spy plane, not UFOs
Around 1 million seed varieties are preserved in the "Doomsday vault" in this country's Arctic island of Spitsbergen
Ethiopians believe this ancient container in the Church of St. Mary of Zion in Axum is the real deal; only 1 priest can view it
Volcanic action created this Icelandic island in the 1960s, providing scientists a lab to study biological colonization

rounds.comments: (Ken: These are responses we have never gone for in any iteration of Jeopardy! They're making their debut.)

clues.text: This word for a small amount is often found before "of applause"
With a fruit at the end of its name, this city on the Bay of Bengal was a French possession even in the time of British India
Bewildered diners in a sushi restaurant may use this Japanese word indicating "chef's choice"
He wrote the novel "True Grit" but his funnier books like "The Dog of the South" won him a cult following
The CDC advises pregnant women not to change cat litter to avoid this 5-syllable parasitic infection
Edgar Degas sculpted "The Little Dancer Aged 14", complete with real ballet shoes & this ballet skirt
This sculptor best known for his seated statue of Lincoln at the Lincoln Memorial co-founded the National Sculpture Society in 1893
Weird, it's abstract but it's also a chicken--it's this, from words for "Life" & "shape", maybe by Jean Arp or Anish Kapoor
A 1928 court case determined that this Romanian's "Bird in Space" was a work of art, not a manufactured object
A 2007 BBC program subtitled "Spiderwoman" is about this artist famous for her spider sculptures, one called "Maman"
In Egyptian myth this sun god sat in heaven, which was said to be supported by Bakhau & Manu, the mountains of sunrise & sunset
This mythical place written about by Plato in 2 of his dialogues was said to be located just west of the Strait of Gibraltar
This dwelling place of the gods in Norse mythology consists of more than a dozen realms, including Thrudheim & Breidablik
In Arthurian legend, this island is said to be ruled by the enchantress Morgan le Fay & her 8 sisters
Medieval Europeans believed in a Christian land in Asia under this king with a 2-word name & the Pope even wrote him a fan letter
We'll lend some Creedence to the category, as CCR sang, "& I wonder, still I wonder", this title
John Mulaney has an amazing story of selecting 21 plays on a diner's jukebox of this 1965 Tom Jones hit
In a 2019 single Sam Smith asked this question of a lying lover
Culture Club hit the top 10 for the first time with this musical question while making us cry with a killer chorus & reggae sound
clues.response: "Do You Really Want To Hurt Me?"

clues.text: On this "White Album" cut, the only non-title lyric, really, is "no one will be watching us"
clues.response: "Why Don't We Do It In The Road?"

clues.text: "International" cocoa concoction for the unmarried Clue character portrayed by Colin Jost's wife
Kermit's colorful theme song about the group that nominated Ralph Nader & always spoiled the fun at festivities
clues.response: "It's Not Easy Being Green" Party pooper

clues.text: Last 4 words of our national anthem, as sung by an animated kitchen appliance & his german-style Pillsbury product
clues.response: home of the brave little toaster strudel

clues.text: "Stacy's Mom" warblers put an actor in the band; once a TV postman, he wandered seeking chivalry & adventure
Numeric sci-fi book about a metaverse, a singular evening of passion & the controversial right to use deadly force as self-defense
Til the early '50s, primary use of a seat belt was in this mode of transportation
What the 1897 Pianola could do without you
The Wankel is the most fully developed & widely known of this type of engine
British teacher knighted with a long sword after inventing a shorthand system
He also invented the rubber dental plate

rounds.text: This 8th president was the last to be elected president while serving as vice president
